page.title: 04OLD BUILDINGS,PURTON STOKE
page.content:
There are {45 }houses in the village. The roof of the{post office}is held up by pieces of a boat. {Pond Farm}belongs to Mr and Mrs Ponting.The farm was built in 1550 and it is a listed building with a Victorian extension.The moat has been there since the 1100s. The{Herb Garden}house was probably built in the 1800s.The walls are two feet thick.The stables have been converted into a gift shop.A man made puddle pond adjoins the herb garden. Behind the herb garden are two meadows which have never been ploughed up.
_ {
